access_key.description: This is the NIFCLOUD access key. It must be provided, but it can also be sourced from the `NIFCLOUD_ACCESS_KEY_ID` env var.

region.description: This is the NIFCLOUD region. It must be provided, but it can also be sourced from the `NIFCLOUD_DEFAULT_REGION` env var.

secret_key.description: This is the NIFCLOUD secret key. It must be provided, but it can also be sourced from the `NIFCLOUD_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY` env var.

accounting_type.description: Accounting type. (1: monthly, 2: pay per use).

address.description: The hostname of the DB instance.

apply_immediately.description: Specifies whether any database modifications are applied immediately, or during the next maintenance window. Default is `false`

availability_zone.description: The AZ for the DB instance.

backup_retention_period.description: The days to retain backups for. If `0` automatic backup will be off

backup_window.description: The daily time range (in UTC) during which automated backups are created if they are enabled. Example: `09:46-10:16`

binlog_retention_period.description: The days to retain binlog for. Be sure to specify `custom_binlog_retention_period = true` as a set

ca_cert_identifier.description: The identifier of the CA certificate for the DB instance.

custom_binlog_retention_period.description: The flag of set binary log retention period. Only MySQL can be specified

db_name.description: The name of the database to create when the DB instance is created. If this parameter is not specified, no database is created.

db_security_group_name.description: The security group name to associate with; which can be managed using the nifcloud_db_security_group resource.

final_snapshot_identifier.description: The name of your final DB snapshot when this DB instance is deleted. Must be provided if `skip_final_snapshot` is set to false.

identifier.description: The name of the DB instance.

instance_class.description: The instance type of the DB instance.

maintenance_window.description: The weekly time range (in UTC) the instance maintenance window. Example: `Sun:05:00-Sun:06:00`

master_private_address.description: Private IP address for master DB.

multi_az.description: If the DB instance is multi AZ enabled.

multi_az_type.description: The type of multi AZ. (0: Data priority, 1: Performance priority) default `0`

parameter_group_name.description: Name of the DB parameter group to associate; which can be managed using the nifcloud_db_parameter_group resource.

password.description: Password for the master DB user.

publicly_accessible.description: Bool to control if instance is publicly accessible. Default is `true`

read_replica_identifier.description: The DB instance name for read replica.

read_replica_private_address.description: Private IP address for read replica.

replicate_source_db.description: Specifies that this resource is a Replicate database, and to use this value as the source database.

skip_final_snapshot.description: Determines whether a final DB snapshot is created before the DB instance is deleted. Defaults to `true` no DBSnapshot is created

slave_private_address.description: Private IP address for master DB.

snapshot_identifier.description: Specifies whether or not to create this database from a snapshot.

storage_type.description: One of `0` (HDD), or `1` (Flash drive). The default is `0`

username.description: Username for the master DB user.

virtual_private_address.description: Private IP address for virtual load balancer.

restore_time.description: The date and time to restore from. Value must be a time in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) format.

source_db_instance_identifier.description: The identifier of the source DB instance from which to restore.

use_latest_restorable_time.description: A boolean value that indicates whether the DB instance is restored from the latest backup time. Defaults to `false`

block.description: A configuration block for restoring a DB instance to an arbitrary point in time.

description.description: The description for the DB parameter group.

family.description: The DB parameter group family name.

name.description: The name of the DB parameter group.

apply_method.description: Indicates when to apply parameter updates.

block.description: Provides a DB parameter group resource.

group_name.description: The name for the db security group.

cidr_ip.description: The CIDR IP Address that allow access. Cannot be specified with `security_group_name` .

security_group_name.description: The security group name that allow access. Cannot be specified with `cidr_ip` .

block.description: A list of the db security group rule objects.
Provides a RDB security group resource.

dhcp_config_id.description: The ID of the dhcp config.

ipaddress_pool_start.description: The start IP address of ipAddressPool.

ipaddress_pool_stop.description: The stop IP address of ipAddressPool.

static_mapping_description.description: The static mapping IP address description.

block.description: A list of static mapping ip address.

default_router.description: The IP address of default gateway.

dhcp_option_id.description: The ID of the dhcp option.

domain_name.description: The domain name used by the client in host name resolution.

domain_name_servers.description: The IP address list of the DNS server.

lease_time.description: The IP address lease time. (Unit: second)

netbios_name_servers.description: The IP address list of the NetBIOS server.

netbios_node_type.description: The NetBIOS node type. (1: Don't use WINS, 2: Don't use broadcast, 4: Priorirtize broadcasting, 8: Prioritize WINS)

ntp_servers.description: The IP address list of the NTP server.

ip_type.description: Choice of the private ip address(true) or public ip address(false).

accounting_type.description: Accounting type. (1: monthly, 2: pay per use).

dns_name.description: The ip address of multi load balancer vip network.

elb_id.description: The id of multi load balancer.

elb_name.description: The name for the multi load balancer.

health_check_expectation_http_code.description: A list of the expected http code.

health_check_path.description: The path of the health check.

health_check_target.description: The target of the health check. Valid pattern is ${PROTOCOL}:${PORT} or ICMP.

instance_port.description: The port on the instance to route to.

instances.description: A list of instance names to place in the multi load balancer pool.

lb_port.description: The port to listen on for the multi load balancer.

network_volume.description: Maximum network volume for the multi load balancer.

protocol.description: The protocol to listen on. Valid values are `HTTP` `HTTPS` `TCP` `UDP`.

route_table_association_id.description: The id of route table association.

route_table_id.description: The id of route table to attach.

session_stickiness_policy_enable.description: The flag of session stickiness policy.

session_stickiness_policy_expiration_per.description: The session stickiness policy expiration period.

session_stickiness_policy_method.description: The session stickiness policy method. (1: Source ip, 2: Cookie)

ssl_certificate_id.description: The id of the SSL certificate you have uploaded to NIFCLOUD.

unhealthy_threshold.description: The number of checks before the instance is declared unhealthy.

version.description: The version of multi load balancer.

ip_address.description: The IP address of multi load balancer.

network_id.description: The ID of the network to attach; 'net-COMMON_GLOBAL' or `net-COMMON_PRIVATE` or private lan network id.

network_name.description: The private lan name of the network to attach.

block.description: Provides a multi load balancer resource.

health_check_path.description: The path of the health check.

health_check_target.description: The target of the health check. Valid pattern is ${PROTOCOL}:${PORT} or ICMP.

instance_port.description: The port on the instance to route to.

instances.description: A list of instance names to place in the multi load balancer pool.

lb_port.description: The port to listen on for the multi load balancer.

protocol.description: The protocol to listen on. Valid values are `HTTP` `HTTPS` `TCP` `UDP`.

session_stickiness_policy_enable.description: The flag of session stickiness policy.

session_stickiness_policy_expiration_per.description: The session stickiness policy expiration period.

session_stickiness_policy_method.description: The session stickiness policy method. (1: Source ip, 2: Cookie)

ssl_certificate_id.description: The id of the SSL certificate you have uploaded to NIFCLOUD.

unhealthy_threshold.description: The number of checks before the instance is declared unhealthy.

block.description: Provides a multi load balancer listener resource.

firewall_group.description: The firewall group name to associate with.

kube_config_raw.description: The raw Kubernetes config to be used by kubectl and other compatible tools.

locations.description: The cluster location. availability zone can be specified.

disabled.description: Disable the HTTP load balancing addon.

block.description: The configs for HTTP load balancer.

instance_type.description: The instance type for node pool.

name.description: The name of the node pool.

node_count.description: The desired node count in this node pool.

name.description: The name for the firewall group.

cidr_ip.description: The CIDR IP address that allow access.

direction.description: The direction of rule being created.

disable_api_termination.description: If true, enables instance termination protection.

image_id.description: The os image identifier to use for the instance.

instance_type.description: The type of instance to start. Updates to this field will trigger a stop/start of the instance.

key_name.description: The key name of the Key Pair to use for the instance; which can be managed using the nifcloud_key_pair resource.

private_ip.description: The private ip address of instance.

public_ip.description: The public ip address of instance.

security_group.description: The security group name to associate with; which can be managed using the nifcloud_security_group resource.

user_data.description: The user data to provide when launching the instance.

ip_address.description: The IP address to select from `static` or `elastic IP address` or `static IP address`; Default(null) is DHCP.

network_id.description: The ID of the network to attach; 'net-COMMON_GLOBAL' or `net-COMMON_PRIVATE` or private lan network id.

network_interface_attachment_id.description: The attachment ID of the additional NIC

						Modifying this field instance will force reboot.

network_name.description: The private lan name of the network to attach.

key_name.description: The name for the key pair.

healthy_threshold.description: The number of checks before the instance is declared healthy.
